name: stealth
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
movement that is quiet and careful in order not to be seen or heard: She moved across the field with the stealth of a cat on the prowl. These thieves operate with terrifying stealth - they can easily steal from the pockets of unsuspecting travellers.
the quality of carrying an action out secretly, so that people do not know it is happening: It would seem that some politicians would prefer to use financial stealth rather than legislation to produce change. The weapons had been acquired by stealth.
More examplesFewer examplesHe can simultaneously run with the ball and cover ground with the stealth of a gazelle."It would be helpful to reduce calorific levels by stealth, so people don't notice there's been a change," he said.

used to refer to aircraft, weapons, etc. that cannot be seen on radar: The stealth fighter can fly 1,500 kilometres per hour without detection. The force relies more heavily on stealth weaponry.
used to refer to something that is done secretly, so that people do not know it is happening: These products work in stealth mode, so that the people being spied on are totally unaware. See also
stealth tax
More examplesFewer examplesA stealth bomber was detected in the city's airspace.It was the world's first effort to build the world's first stealth aircraft.The jet combines supersonic speed and a radar-baffling stealth technology.The investigators utilize stealth tactics to blend into the environment. People were ignorant of the stealth mining of their personal data by political groups and corporations.
